text: Ko Jeong-Woon (born 27 June 1966) is a South Korean professinal athlete. He is best known as an association football player. He was a member of the Korean national team.National-Football-Teams.com, "Ko Jeong-Woon"; retrieved 2012-9-4. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League National cup League cup Continental Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Cheonan Ilhwa Chunma 1989 K League 31 4 ? ? — — — 31 4 1990 K League 21 4 — — — — 21 4 1991 K League 40 13 — — — — 40 13 1992 K League 26 4 — 7 3 — — 33 7 1993 K League 2 0 — 0 0 — — 2 0 1994 K League 21 4 — 0 0 ? ? — 21 4 1995 K League 25 4 — 4 1 ? ? — 29 5 1996 K League 7 1 ? ? 5 3 ? ? 4 2 16 6 Total 173 34 ? ? 16 7 ? ? 4 2 193 43 Cerezo Osaka 1997 J1 League 17 3 ? ? 5 3 — — 22 6 1998 J1 League 12 0 ? ? 2 0 — — 14 0 Total 29 3 ? ? 7 3 — — 36 6 Pohang Steelers 1998 K League 16 5 ? ? — ? ? ? 0 16 5 1999 K League 19 9 ? ? 2 0 ? ? — 21 9 2000 K League 0 0 ? ? 0 0 — — 0 0 2001 K League 0 0 ? ? 4 0 — — 4 0 Total 35 14 ? ? 6 0 ? ? ? 0 41 14 Career total Career total Career total 237 51 ? ? 29 10 ? ? 4 2 270 63 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals South Korea 1989 2 0 1990 9 2 1991 6 1 1992 4 0 1993 9 2 1994 18 2 1995 7 0 1996 11 2 1997 11 1 Career total 77 10 :Scores and results list South Korea's goal tally first.
